definition: to make a fool out of/to fool/to dupe
to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: John made a monkey out of himself while trying to make a fool out of Jim.
sentences.chinese: 约翰本想愚弄吉姆，却让自己出了洋相。

sentences.english: He's not such a fool as you assumed him to be.
sentences.chinese: 他们编造了一套谎言来愚弄人民。

sentences.english: An American who has been short-changed would complain in the vernacular of being "stiffed".
sentences.chinese: 在美国土话中，常把被人愚弄形容成“僵化了。

sentences.english: They weaved a web of lies to fool the people.
sentences.chinese: 他们编造了一套谎言来愚弄人民。

sentences.english: Leave them out somewhere so whoever you're pranking can see them.
sentences.chinese: 然后把它放到你要愚弄的人可以看到的地方。

sentences.english: In France, people call the April Fools “April Fish”.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，被愚弄的人成为“上钩的鱼”。

sentences.english: He's easily fooled due tohis low IQ.
sentences.chinese: 由于低智商，他很容易被愚弄。

sentences.english: Leslie made a big fool of us.
I think we were fooled by penicillin.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我们都被青霉素愚弄了。

sentences.english: Because Benny was a foreigner, his colleagues often made a fool of him.
sentences.chinese: 因为本尼是个外国人，他的同事常常愚弄他。

sentences.english: Don't you let those other boys fool you, got to love that afro hair-do.
sentences.chinese: 不要让其他那些男孩愚弄你，要爱哪种非洲式发型。

sentences.english: You've had another opportunity to try to stupefy me .
sentences.chinese: 你还会有机会来愚弄我的。

sentences.english: He began to give speeches, telling how the mediums were fooling people.
sentences.chinese: 他开始发表演讲，告诉媒体是如何愚弄人民。

sentences.english: Don't be fooled by the simplicity of the steps.
sentences.chinese: 不要被这些步骤的简洁所愚弄。

sentences.english: One is easily fooled by that which one love. ----Moliere.
sentences.chinese: 人易被自己所爱之人愚弄。

definition: to play with/to engage in/to resort to/to dally with
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to play with/to toy with/to dally with/to engage in/to resort to
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
